explanation.rules:
If the number of syllables in the word (= stem + ending) is even, all syllables are short. If the number of syllables in the word is odd, the last even-numbered syllable of the stem is lengthened.
•        2 = 2 + 0: bu₁ɲa²-∅
•        4 = 2 + 2: bu₁ɲa²-gi₃mbal⁴
•        4 = 3 + 1: gu₁da²ga₃-bi⁴
•        4 = 4 + 0: mu₁yu²ba₃ra⁴-∅
•        3 = 2 + 1: ba₁ma:₂ -gu₃
•        3 = 3 + 0: gu₁da:₂ga₃-∅
•        5 = 3 + 2: ɟu₁du:₂lu₃-mu₄ɟay₅
•        5 = 4 + 1: ga₁ɟa₂gi₃mba:⁴ -gu₅
 If the ending -ni or -mu immediately follows a long vowel, it loses its own vowel.
